data.chText: 流言飞语；闲言碎语
data.enText: informal talk or stories about other people's private lives, that may be unkind or not true

data.chText: 别对那些道听途说都信以为真。
data.enText: Don't believe all the gossip you hear.

data.chText: 把最新的小道消息都讲给我听听吧！
data.enText: Tell me all the latest gossip !

data.chText: 有小道消息说他在股票交易中赔了一大笔钱。
data.enText: The gossip was that he had lost a fortune on the stock exchange.

data.chText: 大家议论纷纷说他们之间关系暧昧。
data.enText: It was common gossip (= everyone said so) that they were having an affair.

data.chText: 她很喜欢说别人闲话。
data.enText: She's a great one for idle gossip (= she enjoys spreading stories about other people that are probably not true) .

data.chText: 说长道短；闲聊
data.enText: a conversation about other people and their private lives

data.chText: 我喜欢闲聊天。
data.enText: I love a good gossip.

data.chText: 喜欢传播流言飞语的人；爱说长道短（或说三道四）的人
data.enText: a person who enjoys talking about other people's private lives

data.chText: 闲聊式的信；爱说三道四的邻居
data.enText: a gossipy letter/neighbour

data.chText: 传播流言飞语；说三道四；说长道短
data.enText: to talk about other people's private lives, often in an unkind way

data.chText: 我不能整天站在这儿闲聊啊。
data.enText: I can't stand here gossiping all day.

data.chText: 她一直在说你的闲话。
data.enText: She's been gossiping about you.

data.text: discussion ♦ conversation ♦ dialogue ♦ talk ♦ consultation ♦ chat ♦ gossip

data.chText: 以上各词均表示交谈、谈论。
data.enText: These are all words for a conversation about sth.
discussion

data.chText: 指讨论、谈论、商讨认为重要的事情：
data.enText: a detailed conversation about sth that is considered to be important

data.chText: 两位领导人仍在进行讨论。
data.enText: Discussions are still taking place between the two leaders.
conversation

data.chText: 通常指私下的或非正式的交谈、谈话：
data.enText: a talk, usually a private or informal one, involving two people or a small group; the activity of talking in this way

data.chText: 电话交谈
data.enText: a telephone conversation
dialogue

data.chText: 指书、戏剧或电影中的对话、对白：
data.enText: conversations in a book, play or film

data.chText: 这部小说描述多、对话少。
data.enText: The novel has long descriptions and not much dialogue.

data.chText: dialogue亦指两个团体间为解决问题或结束争端进行的正式对话、讨论、交换意见：
data.enText: A dialogue is also a formal discussion between two groups, especially when they are trying to solve a problem or end a dispute.

data.chText: 总统告诉等候的记者，刚才进行了一次富有建设性的对话。
data.enText: The President told waiting reporters there had been a constructive dialogue.
talk

data.chText: 常指就某个问题或对有关人员重要的事情进行的交谈、谈话、讨论、商讨：
data.enText: a conversation or discussion, often one about a problem or sth important for the people involved

data.chText: 我和老板就我的事业前景进行了一次长谈。
data.enText: I had a long talk with my boss about my career prospects.
consultation

data.chText: 指团体间在决策前进行的咨询、商讨、磋商：
data.enText: a formal discussion between groups of people before a decision is made about sth

data.chText: 两国之间进行了广泛磋商。
data.enText: There have been extensive consultations between the two countries.
chat

data.chText: 指友好的非正式谈话、聊天
data.enText: a friendly informal conversation; informal talking

data.chText: chat作可数名词尤用于英国英语：
data.enText: The countable use of chat is especially British English.

data.chText: 我只是打电话来随便聊聊孩子的事情。
data.enText: I just called in for a chat about the kids.
gossip

data.chText: 指关于他人或其私生活的闲谈、闲聊、说长道短：
data.enText: a conversation about other people and their private lives

data.chText: 我们讲了一会儿老板的闲话。
data.enText: We had a good gossip about the boss.
a discussion/conversation/dialogue/consultation/chat/gossip about sth
a discussion/conversation/dialogue/consultation on sth
in (close) discussion/conversation/dialogue/consultation with sb
a brief/short/long discussion/conversation/talk/consultation/chat/gossip
to have a discussion/conversation/dialogue/talk/consultation/chat/gossip with sb
to hold a discussion/conversation/dialogue/consultation
to bring a discussion/conversation around/round to…

word_means: 喜欢传播流言蜚语的人

means: 喜欢传播流言蜚语的人
爱说长道短(或说三道四)的人

ex.chText: 她喜欢议论邻居们的是非长短。
ex.enText: She loves to gossip about her neighbours.

ex.chText: 人们已经开始说他们的闲话了。
ex.enText: People have started to gossip about them.

synonyms.bx: 指背后谈论他人的行为或隐私。

ex.chText: 他们在没完没了地谈论宠物。
ex.enText: They were tattling about pets endlessly.

ex.chText: 有些妇女喜欢说别人的闲话。
ex.enText: Some women like tattling on others.

synonyms.bx: 既指闲谈，也指背后谈论他人的隐私。

tr: light informal conversation for social occasions
a report (often malicious) about the behavior of other people
a person given to gossiping and divulging personal information about others
talk socially without exchanging too much information
example: the men were sitting in the cafe and shooting the breeze

tr: speak about others and reveal secrets or intimacies

value.def: Gossip is informal conversation, often about other people's private affairs.

example.ex: He spent the first hour talking gossip...
example.tran: 他头一个小时都在闲聊。

example.ex: There has been much gossip about the possible reasons for his absence...
example.tran: 关于他缺席的原因有很多传言。

example.ex: Don't you like a good gossip?

value.tran: 流言蜚语；小道消息；闲话

value.def: If you gossip with someone, you talk informally, especially about other people or local events. You can also say that two people gossip .

example.ex: We spoke, debated, gossiped into the night...
example.tran: 我们交谈着，争论着，闲聊着，一直持续到晚上。
利利怀特夫人从来不说长道短。

value.def: If you describe someone as a gossip, you mean that they enjoy talking informally to people about the private affairs of others.

example.tran: 他总是喜欢说别人的坏话。

trans: 漫谈栏，茶话栏(报刊有关社交活动和名人私生活的专栏)

tag: 喜欢传播流言蜚语的人
